intro: Thelymitra tholiformis, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Australia. It is characterized by its compact, leafy growth habit and produces small, greenish-white flowers with a distinctive hooded lip. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. Its morphology includes a short rhizome and a single or few leaves, with the flowers emerging from the base of the foliage. Thelymitra tholiformis is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought and poor soil conditions.
